newsitem.title: ESTONIA: TALLINNA PANK APPROVES SHARE CAPITAL RISE.
newsitem.headline: TALLINNA PANK APPROVES SHARE CAPITAL RISE.

text.p: Shareholders of Tallinna Pank, Estonia's fourth largest bank, approved an additional 10 million kroons share issue for 1997, the bank said on Monday.

The share emission will take place in the second to fourth quarters of 1997 with one million shares of 10 kroons nominal to be issued, the bank said in a statment after a shareholder meeting on Saturday.
Existing shareholders will not be given priority purchase rights and the purchase price will be deteremined by the board at a later date, the bank added.

The shareholders meeting also decided to place 36.6 million kroons of the bank's 1996 profit into a general banking reserve with 9.5 million kroons of the total allocated to the income tax reserve, the bank said.
Tallinna Pank's profit forcast for 1997 was 87.3 million kroons, the bank added.
Tallinna Pank group's audited profit for 1996 was 50.4 million kroons, an increase of 52 percent on 1995, the bank said.
